subject: Law
title: Retribution vs. Rehabilitation
description: A short lesson to help you apply Retribution vs. Rehabilitation.

hook.text: A thief goes to prison. Is the goal to punish him for what he didâ€”or to help him not do it again?

buildup.text: Retribution says punishment is deserved: you committed a wrong, so you must pay for it proportionally.

discovery.text: Rehabilitation says punishment should reform: the goal is reducing future crime through treatment and education.

twist.text: The US leans retributive: long sentences, harsh conditions. Nordic countries lean rehabilitative with lower recidivism.

climax.text: Most modern systems blend both. The balance between them defines a society's approach to criminal justice.

punchline.text: Punish the past or fix the future? The answer shapes the entire system.

quiz.question: What does rehabilitation in criminal justice focus on?
options: Reforming offenders to reduce future crime
